channel.title: Homepage on Log of Lapis
channel.description: Recent content in Homepage on Log of Lapis

item.title: New Topics: Shut Up and Listen
item.description: Or: How you need to learn to stop talking and try new things. No, seriously. You think you are open minded? How much?

item.title: A reflection on "TERF".
item.description: The more I’ve been pushing myself to be more independent, and to just grow in a positive direction, the more I realize that so many people just aren’t worth listening to.

item.title: Discord and Communication.
item.description: I’m going to preface this by saying this happens to every company. Discord isn’t an exception, it just so happens to be the next in line, much to my dismay.

item.title: Discord and File Hosting.
item.description:
It turns out a lot of people use Discord as a file host. Probably because:

  • It’s quick
  • It’s easy
  • It’s free*

item.title: Discord.
item.description: I’ve been on Discord for a long time. Since 2016, even.

item.title: A terrible absence.
item.description: I haven’t posted anything in a while. Again.

item.title: Obligatory diary.
item.description: I haven’t posted anything in a while.

item.title: Hello, Navi.
item.description: This was going to be a placeholder with nothing but a Serial Experiments Lain reference, but that’d be ridiculous.

item.title: How is this?
item.description: I use the following to make this site work: Hugo alaGeek GitHub Pages Alcohol Magic

item.title: What is this?
item.description: This site is my personal Outernet web page, graciously hosted by the Community of Starry Point and constructed with the help of Hugo and broadcast with the help of the NETeSCAPE Innernet Self Beacon. If you live in the Innernet, please come and say hi, I welcome visitors at all times. For any prospective reading this that are confused on what the hell I just said, don’t worry about it, it doesn’t apply to you.

item.title: When is this?
item.description: If my timekeeping is correct, it should be sometime after 0003, or 2023. What, you’re asking me when I get things done? Whenever. That’s my policy.

item.title: Where is this?
item.description: I host this site on GitHub Pages, since getting consistent routing to and from the Starry Point Lighthouse is a pain. I could do it from the Tunnelvision Arcade, but I already have enough power hungry cabinets in there as it is. If you’re asking where I live, you can find me at the Starry Point Lighthouse on the Innernet. If you’re asking for physical location, go away. I don’t take kindly to creeps.

item.title: Who is friend?
item.description: These are links to other blogs and personal sites made by my friends. Do check them out. CominAtYou kirb

item.title: Who is this?
item.description: I am Lapis. I also go by Ren (renavi) as an online name. I predominantly write and worldbuild, but I sometimes do other things, depending on what I feel suits me best for the time. Outside of writing, I study Japanese. I wish to be a translator at some point in my life. An eventuality. I am a lover of: Retro consoles. Y2K/Metalheart aesthetic. Shitposting. The Starry Point Lighthouse. My real name will never be posted on this site.

item.title: Why is this?
item.description: Why do I have my own personal site? I want to. This is my own little corner of the Innernet and Outernet, and if anything, I’m glad you just stopped to say hi. If you’re wondering why my website is structured like this, I like it. I took a few pages from NETeSCAPE, they’re nice folk. If you wish to follow my efforts, please take a look at where I am.
